ygData.subject: Re: Back to the Ark!
ygData.msgSnippet: Inside the Ark, Quickstride looks at Uproar with a not so pleased look on his face.  Ya know, maybe we should never have gone with that idea of yours. Uproar

Inside the Ark, Quickstride looks at Uproar with a not so pleased look on h=
is face.

" Ya know, maybe we should never have gone with that idea of your=
s."

Uproar gives a sheepish grin.

"Yep, my bad.  As always."

Quickstride=
 nodds, and sends an oxygen neutralization mist, to clear out the stench.

=
"There, hopefully that'll work.  And next time, don't get me in trouble aga=
in."

Uproar shrugs.

"Right, ignore my bright ideas, they usually don't wo=
rk anyway."

Quickstride looks to Leo ll and then looks around.

"Hmm, I wo=
nder...  I know there's a control room around here somewhere..  I'm not too=
 good at the technological stuff, but, I used to do a few things, like cont=
rol climate, monitor parameters, that sorta thing.  I wonder if we can gain=
 access into the control box, and bypass everything the intruder's done so =
far?"

Uproar knew where the control box was, he points upwards.

"I know w=
here the box is, but getting to it, that might not be easy."

On the way ba=
ck to the Ark, it was clear that Tucson sensed that history was partially r=
epeating itself, from the day he had been taken off line during a harrowing=
 battle vorns ago.  He was not about to let anyone down a second time, and =
certainly not willing to give up to any of the minions, or Hydras's low lif=
e commandoes.  

"Talon, I deeply appreciate your concern, and take it grea=
tly into heart.  But, I've failed our factions once before, I can not and w=
ill not let that happen again.  I have to do this, to stop history from rep=
eating itself."

Night Shift could tell Tucson was getting ready to put it =
into battle gear.

"Look, big guy, Talon's right, you're in no condition ta=
 put up a fight.  You're just gonna get yourself even more damaged than ya =
already are."

Rat Trap nodds.

"They're right Wheels, you can't just throw=
 yourself out there at sixty percent power ratio.  It's like ya said, somet=
imes, we don't always win the battle, but eventually we'll win the war."

S=
traight Shot listens too.

"I second that.  No one expects you to always sa=
ve the day, Tucson.  You've stretched yourself over your limits far too man=
y times, and it's time you gave yourself time to recharge."

Tucson sighs.
=

" There isn't any time for that Straight Shot.  For every moment I take to=
 recharge, more destruction is inflicted.  Lord Elder is in severe disrepai=
r, everyone there is in grave danger, and there is an enemy unseen by anyon=
e's scanners that is wreaking havoc in our home.  No, I will not rest until=
 this enemy is dealt with."

Night Shift groans.

"Slag, are you stubborn, =
Tucson.  You're not ready for another fight, plain'n simple!"

Tucson's inn=
er cab vibrates, a slight effect of his emotional state.

"Night Shift, don=
't.  I'll do what needs to be done regardless of my condition.  I owe you a=
ll that much. I owe you your freedom and your saftey.  I owe everyone that.=
"

Rat Trap too, gets upset.

" Wheels, will ya just listen ta us this time=
?!  Ya can't go inta battle the way you are!  There's more chances of them =
send'n ya ta the junkyard now than there is when you're runn'n with a hundr=
ed percent of your power!  You got nothn' left!  You try ta fight now you c=
ould go off line permanently!  YOUR LIFE IS DEPENDING ON IT!"

Straight Sho=
t sits up.

"Thank you Rat Trap, exactly what you said.  If we have to temp=
orarilly take you off line Tucson we'll do that for the sake of saving your=
 aft! Now Rodimus doesn't want you to risk your life, and neither does anyo=
ne else!  For once, LISTEN TO US!"

Tucson pauses.

" Bantor, I - need you =
to go ahead to back up the other Fuzors, and to see if Rodimus needs your h=
elp.  I can now drive myself with the energy I've got left.  I will arrive =
at the Ark shortly following your arrival there.  Primus be with you."

Eve=
ryone heaves a sigh of releif. Especially Rat Trap.

"Good choice.  So, wha=
t next Wheels?"

Tucson replies as he warms up his engine to continue on hi=
s own wheels.

" It seems that whoever has taken control of the Ark, has ta=
mpered with it's configuration, via the mainframe.  There is only one thing=
 that could possibly interrupt that.  My sonar system.  It has the ability =
to disrupt most alien programming, and perhaps with enough of a disruption,=
 we may - just be able to gain control of it again."

Rat Trap grins.

"Hee=
eeey, that's right, that'll create a weankess in the programming and that's=
 when we can take advantage of reclaiming the configurations.  Better get b=
ack ta Rodimus and the others about that."

Tucson acknolwedges and contact=
s Rodimus.

"Tucson Prime to Rodimus Prime, over.  As soon as I am close en=
ough to the ark, I am going to attempt a short range sonar disruption inter=
cept of the Ark's systems.  Hopefully this will cause enough of a falter, f=
or us to regain control of the system via an interruption of frequencies.  =
Tell - Legacy to be ready to intercept the mainframe on my mark.  Tucson Pr=
ime out."

Straight Shot smiles.

"Now that's the Tucson Prime I know.  Res=
ourceful yet sensible.  Just like a truck should be."
